title: red_nonsense
author: red_nonsense
content: Please, help me with marketplace bitopro.net it's a real market or fake ?

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.created_time: July 14, 2022, 09:29:07 PMLast edit: May 14, 2023, 03:48:28 PM by JeromeTash
comments.body: Seems fake. I wouldn't trust the exchange with even a few satsthe domain was registered not so long ago according to whoisCode:Domain: bitopro.netRegistrar: PDR Ltd. d/b/a PublicDomainRegistry.comRegistered On: 2022-04-19Expires On: 2023-04-19Updated On: 2022-04-21But when look at their terms of service. It says that they were Last updated: February 25th, 2021 which means most of the things about the site are just copy-paste

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I guess it's a clone site of bitopro.com this site is usually promoted on the Chinese local section but even bitopro.com do not have yet reviews. Plus the domain .net is newly registered which is obvious it is not safe to use unless someone trusted here on the forum tested them. How did you find this website?Ooopppsss... after trying to access the website my AV reacted.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Take a look at their recent trades and orderbook. The exchange is pretty new in the game and almost no one has heard of it, yet they are making a lot of trades... it doesn't make sense.A closer look will tell you the same numbers are being repeated from: BTC/ETH pair

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.created_time: July 15, 2022, 04:12:37 AMLast edit: June 07, 2023, 06:11:34 PM by yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on July 15, 2022, 03:43:06 AMTake a look at their recent trades and orderbook. The exchange is pretty new in the game and almost no one has heard of it, yet they are making a lot of trades... it doesn't make sense.A closer look will tell you the same numbers are being repeated from: BTC/ETH pairFake volume is pretty much saying scam IMO. I am not saying it's definitely a scam but I've never heard of the place til this thread coupled with the fake volume would def make me skeptical.Â  I wouldn't touch this with a 10 foot pole.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on July 14, 2022, 11:59:05 PMI guess it's a clone site of bitopro.com this site is usually promoted on the Chinese local section but even bitopro.com do not have yet reviews. They have similar names, but the ".net" domain extension is using a different theme/template... Did some digging and found a bunch of other similar/fake websites (bitrunex.com, bitsflex.com, bitwemix.com and digitalwala.online [they even forgot to remove Bitrunex's name from the header area ]).

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on July 14, 2022, 11:59:05 PMI guess it's a clone site of bitopro.com this site is usually promoted on the Chinese local section but even bitopro.com do not have yet reviews. Plus the domain .net is newly registered which is obvious it is not safe to use unless someone trusted here on the forum tested them. How did you find this website?Ooopppsss... after trying to access the website my AV reacted.Same results from my Kaspersky this is the kind of exchange that you're not going to use, why use this exchange when the industry is not lacking with reputable exchanges, even if they have good features or cheap trading fees you should not use an exchange that has issues with anti-virus and have not yet establish its reputation.
